metadata.title: CVE-2017-9217 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
systemd-resolved through 233 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (daemon crash) via a crafted DNS response with an empty questionsection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu19
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu19
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu19
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu19
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu19
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu19
systemd - 229-4ubuntu19
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu19
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu19
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu19
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu19
udev - 229-4ubuntu19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu19').
